intro: Montanoa tomentosa var. xanthiifolia, commonly known as the yellowleaf montanoa, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Its leaves are often covered in a dense layer of white to grayish pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
